meanings.definition: Developing industries in a country or region.
meanings.sent1: The industrialising of our town has brought new job opportunities.
meanings.sent2: The government is focusing on industrialising rural areas to boost the economy.
meanings.sent3: The industrialising of the old factory turned it into a bustling hub of activity.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for industrialising small businesses transformed the local market.
meanings.sent5: The industrialising of the region was like watching a dormant volcano come to life.

meanings.sent1: The industrialising of the nation led to rapid urbanization.
meanings.sent2: Many countries went through industrialising during the 19th century.
meanings.sent3: The industrialising of the small village was like a caterpillar turning into a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to industrialising the company made it a global player.
meanings.sent5: The industrialising of the economy was a monumental shift in history.
